question_sentence: Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich announced he will sell which English Premier League club?
What happened to the cargo ship carrying thousands of luxury cars in the Atlantic Ocean?
choices: It has been salvaged by U.S. traders
It sunk to the ocean floor

question_sentence: In Pennsylvania, this past Tuesday was known as Fastnacht Day or:
MLB is set to lose regular season games due to labor dispute for the first time since:
Dua Lipa is facing a copyright infringement lawsuit over which hit song?
Russia’s richest man, Alexei Mordashov, has been blacklisted by the European Union. The 31-year-old has a net worth of almost:
Which of these celebrities is officially single after a Los Angeles judge granted their motion seeking legal status?
President Joe Biden, speaking about fighting inflation during his State of the Union address, said which statement:
choices: "Let's take it one day at a time."

question_sentence: Fitbit recalled 1 million of its watches, citing:
When asked if the Tampa Bay Buccaneers would accommodate Tom Brady if he wanted to be traded this offseason, coach Bruce Arians said:
How large is the pay rise that MPs will receive next month?
evidence: The pay booster, which is decided upon by an independent body, is equal to the average increase in pay for public sector workers

question_sentence: What was the name of the political satire series that Volodymyr Zelenskyy starred in before being elected Ukrainian president?
evidence: Zelenskyy played a history teacher who inadvertently becomes president of Ukraine for three seasons before being elected to do the job for real in 2019

question_sentence: The Dutch food safety regulator has issued warnings after it was discovered that some bottles of which world famous champagne brand contain lethal doses of ecstasy?
evidence: The watchdog warned that double-magnum bottles of Moët & Chandon Ice Impérial champagne could be dangerous after MDMA poisoning killed one person and left 11 others seriously ill in Germany

question_sentence: Which store chain is scrapping its iconic ‘Never Knowingly Undersold’ pledge after almost 100 years?
evidence: The department store first started using the motto in 1925 when the company had just two stores, but it has become increasingly obsolete due to the rise of online shopping

question_sentence: Which vulnerable dog breed has been ‘saved’ from extinction thanks to the pandemic?
evidence: Lifestyle changes caused by the pandemic saw the registration of the puppies increase by 66% last year,  The Kennel Club said, having been put on the list of vulnerable breeds in 2020

question_sentence: Researchers have discovered that what emotion could act as a natural painkiller?
evidence: Researchers at the Chinese Academy of Sciences found there to be a relationship between fond memories and the areas of the brain which perceive and register pain. Find out more on The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: Former health secretary Matt Hancock gave his first interview since his career-derailing affair on which podcast?
evidence: During the two hour chat with host Steven Bartlett, Hancock opened up about his affair with university friend and colleague Gina Coladangelo, explaining it was ‘out of his control’

question_sentence: What is the eponymous name of the storybook series written by Shirley Hughes that follows a boy and his sister Annie Rose?
evidence: Hughes, who died this week aged 94, wrote more than 50 books and illustrated around 200 more, including the Alfie series and Dogger, a story about a boy who loses his toy dog

question_sentence: What is the new legal name of the rapper formerly known as Kanye West?
evidence: The rapper legally changed his name in October 2021 having  used Ye as a nickname for several years prior

question_sentence: How many people has the UN predicted will need urgent humanitarian aid this year?
evidence: The figure has increased drastically following the US withdrawal from Afghanistan where half the population is in acute humanitarian need. Find out more on The Overview podcast

question_sentence: Which of the following tech companies banned Russian state media outlets from running ads on their content this week?
evidence: Google, Meta and YouTube are among the growing list of companies that will no longer allow Russian state media outlets to run ads on their platforms in response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

question_sentence: Which business mogul activated a satellite-based internet service in Ukraine for people who saw their traditional service interrupted by the Russian invasion?
evidence: SpaceX founder and CEO Elon Musk announced that he has activated Starlink internet service in Ukraine as the country suffered power outages and gaps in internet service due to Russia’s invasion. Musk also sent a shipment of Starlink user terminals to allow people to access the service and said more were “en route.”

question_sentence: Will Smith delivered an emotional acceptance speech after winning the award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Leading Role during which awards show?
evidence: Will Smith was awarded the prestigious accolade at the 28th Screen Actors Guild Awards on Sunday, which honor some of the year’s best television and film performances by actors.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden delivered his first State of the Union address earlier this week. Which ambassador did he invite as a special guest?
evidence: Biden extended an invitation the Ukrainian ambassador to the US as a special guest of first lady Jill Biden, marking a high point in his speech as everyone in the chamber — Democrats and Republicans —rose to their feet to cheer.

question_sentence: The confirmation process is underway for Biden’s historic nominee to the Supreme Court. What is her name?
evidence: The confirmation process for Ketanji Brown Jackson is in full-swing, potentially leading to her becoming the first Black woman to sit on the highest court in the nation.

question_sentence: Airbnb is offering free temporary housing for how many Ukrainian refugees who have been displaced by Russia’s invasion?
evidence: Airbnb is offering free short-term stays for up to 100,000 Ukrainians. The housing will be funded by donations to the Airbnb.org Refugee Fund as well as with help from hosts on the platform.

question_sentence: Several dangerous bacterial infections in infants have recently been linked to which baby product?
evidence: The CDC and the FDA are investigating reports and complaints of infant illness related to a recalled lot of Similac baby formula from a production facility in Michigan.

question_sentence: Which of the following energy companies announced plans to leave Russia?
evidence: BP, Shell and ExxonMobil have all signaled they will exit the oil-rich country due to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

question_sentence: Which US state kicked off the nation’s 2022 midterm elections this week by holding primaries?
evidence: Texas held the nation’s first primaries on Tuesday. Political contests in the Lone Star State are poised to set the landscape for elections in November that could swing control of Congress to Republicans.

question_sentence: Why is Major League Baseball postponing its March 31 Opening Day and canceling the first two series of regular season games?
choices: A work stoppage over a collective bargaining agreement
Trucker protests blocking roads near stadiums
evidence: The MLB is in the midst of a lockout because a collective bargaining agreement that determines players’ terms and conditions of employment has not yet been reached. This is the first official work stoppage in professional baseball since the 1994-1995 season.
